intro: Manisuris acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed manisuris, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
